table.name: civicrm_relationship_type
table.comment: Relationship types s/b structured with contact_a as the 'subject/child' contact and contact_b as the 'object/parent' contact (e.g. Individual A is Employee of Org B).

field.name: name_a_b
field.title: Relationship Type Name A to B
field.comment: name for relationship of contact_a to contact_b.

field.name: label_a_b
field.title: Relationship Type Label A to B
field.comment: label for relationship of contact_a to contact_b.

field.name: name_b_a
field.title: Relationship Type Name B to A
field.comment: Optional name for relationship of contact_b to contact_a.

field.name: label_b_a
field.title: Relationship Type Label B to A
field.comment: Optional label for relationship of contact_b to contact_a.

field.name: description
field.title: Relationship Description
field.comment: Optional verbose description of the relationship type.

field.name: contact_type_a
field.title: Contact Type for Contact A
field.comment: If defined, contact_a in a relationship of this type must be a specific contact_type.

field.name: contact_type_b
field.title: Contact Type for Contact B
field.comment: If defined, contact_b in a relationship of this type must be a specific contact_type.

field.name: contact_sub_type_a
field.title: Contact Subtype A
field.comment: If defined, contact_sub_type_a in a relationship of this type must be a specific contact_sub_type.

field.name: contact_sub_type_b
field.title: Contact Subtype B
field.comment: If defined, contact_sub_type_b in a relationship of this type must be a specific contact_sub_type.

field.name: is_reserved
field.title: Relationship Type is Reserved
field.comment: Is this relationship type a predefined system type (can not be changed or de-activated)?

field.name: is_active
field.title: Relationship Type is Active
field.comment: Is this relationship type currently active (i.e. can be used when creating or editing relationships)?
